First reason to buy this phone, The US government said not to! Seriously this was a huge reason for me as I noticed they were dwarfing samsung in sales and getting closer to toppling I phone from #1. If you looked at the Honor 7x and wanted a extra Gb of ram and 32 more GB of storage this is a must have. It also boasts a large 5.93" screen with minimal bezel. Oh so sexy for a budget device. It has a solid build and beautiful screen. After having it for over a week I noticed most complaints were unwarranted since some people are spoiled by more robust screens.

Granted this is not a "flagship level" phone but for the price it delivers above what any reasonable person would expect. The finger print sensor needed some getting used to. I have never had a phone like this before. It defiantly beet the Galaxy s4, Blu energy x plus, ZTE and other phones I have owned in function and form.

I love the screen most although it is not for small handed people except for the shrink feature allowing one handed use. It even has eye comfort built right in. Love that. The US government has no real proof to there allegations since there has not even been a formal charge filed against Huewai and seriously I doubt this company would jeopardize their profit margin with such foolery.

If you need a honest opinion buy it you will love it, just remember no matter how good the phone apps can still be less than perfect.

Ulasan: What an amazing phone I totally love this phone I can't believe the money that people spend on Samsungs and iPhones that's ridiculous. This phone is absolutely the bomb for the price if absolutely cannot be beat. I've been a Apple user for the past decade and I think I'm now going to change. This Huawei rocks and I'm looking forward to getting there Mate 10 laptop. The fingerprint recognition is super fast. This camera also takes amazing pictures and it's response time is really quick I don't have to wait for anything to open up boom it's there. The biggest downside for me is that you can't hook it up to a TV via HDMI adapter. You have to have a smart TV and you can mirror it Bluetooth Style. The second time I left it out in the rain and it was never quite the same after that. The phone turned on but it never ran properly. I'm still impressed because I never expected it to work after I jump in the ocean. Great phone well-built durable it's a rockstar.

Ulasan:
I know, it's not the name brands we all "want". But I can't afford those name brands. And, really, who needs so many bells and whistles?

This phone does plenty of what those phones do and at half the price. I've had a Huawei in the past and liked it well enough that when I was forced to replace a dying phone, I went with this brand because I had such good luck with it.

This one is a good size. If you have eyes that don't see so well, you may have to download a text enhancer for bigger text. The messages are not color coded and the text size is limited. Easily fixed with apps, but that's one of those bells/whistles I do miss; customization.

There are some apps on it I didn't expect and found very helpful. I'm really not missing too much that I know of. :)

Good value. Works well; better than a Samsung I once had...just sayin'. A good mid-level phone.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I did a lot of searching before I decided on an upgrade to my Moto X Pure. I was thinking about the moto G4 and Honor 7x but ultimately picked the Mate Se which is an upgraded Honor 7x.

Shipping from Amazon was fast and hassle free. No surprises there.

The actual phone is great. It came with a clear case which was unexpected. I had already purchased a case. The biggest pro about this phone is the battery life which is crazy. I can go days without charging it. The phone is lightning fast and responsive. No waiting or slow transistions. The fingerprint scan on the backside of the phone is great. It works flawlessly and recognizes my fingerprint instantly.

I normally root my phones for performance reasons but decided not to root this phone. Sometimes it's more of a hassle than what it's worth. I like stock Android ROMs. EMUI is not a "heavy" interface like Samsung phones. I use Nova Launcher and the phone is as, good as stock android. There are a lot of apps out there now that allow you to block ads so this phone runs great without root.

Transferring apps and messages was a breeze using Huawei's transferring app.

Only thing to remember is there's no NFC and no 5 ghz capability for WiFi. It's a non issue to me.

Only con in my opinion is the speaker. The Moto X Pure had two speakers so you got a louder, more stereo sound. the one speaker on the Mate SE is some what loud but very tingy. Overall, I love the phone. Great purchase.

Battery life is long. I'm not a heavy user and, in the evening, after being in and out of my pocket all day, I still have about 85% battery. There was a problem with Bluetooth slowing Wifi down to a crawl when I first bought it but it upgraded to Oreo and that problem was resolved. The fingerprint reader works well except for when my hands are wet and I have to wait for them to dry before I can use the phone. I have no regrets.

This phone is worth every single penny you pay.

Ulasan: Bought this for our daughter who broke her iPhone but not eligible for an upgrade and no insurance. Still have to pay on a broken phone, but daughter needed one. She actually likes this one better than her iphone!! Less glitchy, and she's always liked the Android apps better. I couldn't be happier with this purchase and for the price, you can't beat it! Husband and I are seriously considering Huawei phones purchased outright instead of Samsung and monthly payments!
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I've had this phone for about 5 months now and don't have a single complaint. Like others, I was skeptical at first. I've always had Samsung Galaxy phones and my current one needed upgrading, but didn't want to spend another $900 for a s9 plus.

I came across this one based on something I read on cnet and decided to give it a shot. It's completely lived up to expectations and more. Everything I do on a Samsung phone can be done on this one to the same level. It's fast, never freezes, streams videos with ease, and the sound quality is good. Battery life is great. It lasts forever. Picture quality is fine, but not as good as you'd get from a Samsung or iPhone. I don't take many pictures so I really don't care about having the best quality pictures, but it's more than adequate for me.

In short, if you're on the fence about this phone, don't be. Get it. I'll never high prices for a Samsung again when phones like this are available.
Label: Postif

Ulasan: This phone is absolutely awesome. I have had a couple of galaxies in the past, the most recent being the S7 Edge, and I had more hang ups and problems with the Galaxies. The phone looks and feels really nice, the screen is beautiful, and the fingerprint scanner is great. The photo quality seems fine to me and the camera app opens very quickly so you don't miss any good shots. I have only two complaints: it has good specs and plenty of memory, but you can't install Fortnite on it, and it has the 18:9 screen ratio, so 16:9 videos have space on either size, but this is just my preference.
Label: Postif

Ulasan: OMG! I will never spend $1000 on a phone again. My carrier is MetroPCs, which uses T-Mobile bands. I have no issues with LTE or phone signal whatsoever. I did make a mistake when switching SIM cards though. When I received it, I switched SIM card and it didn't work. I thought it was the phone not compatible with my carrier, but it turns out I had to call the Carrier and they will have to reactivate the SIM card using the new phone's unique ID. That took 2 minutes over phone and it was done absolutely free. Ever since then, no issues at all. So please call your carrier to inquire about the SIM card transferring to the new phone. Phone runs super fast and has the exact same internal storage amount (64GB) as my old iphone 6s that has been giving me issues charging for months. Not to mention, I can buy a SD card to extend the storage to $256GB!!! This phone has very long hours of battery and fast operation. Takes decent pictures as well. I can't believe it took me so long to switch! The only thing is that the selfie camera is not as good as my iphone, which is ok with me, since I barely take any selfies anyway.
Label: Postif

Ulasan: I went to downtown yesterday. My son used my phone playing games online for one hour on the way. Then I used my phone google map as my GPS for one hour. My son played games during lunch time and break time. I took some photos at night. Then it was still 50% power left when we got on the train. My son watched videos for a hour on the train. It was 40% power left when we arrived home. Cool! It is in winter. My previous Samsung phone never had such long standby time. Moreover, charging battery is super fast. I am very happy with it. However, about taking pictures, the phone has an automatic beautification function. Although I turned off the beautification function, but in the pic the human skin is still too smooth, and even my lunch is beautified. This, I don't really like it.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Very happy with this Huawei Mate SE purchase! The overall quality is excellent especially for a $200 phone.
The main feature I value is the 4GB of Ram. Apps run well, internet pages load quickly, app update installs are quick, etc. The local storage allows many multiple apps to be installed along with videos, music, etc, Additionally I use Nova Launcher instead of the native one and there is no lag whatsoever.

Other features I like include:
- Being able to access the SD card without opening case
- There is a 3mm headphone jack
- The fingerprint reader is lightening fast
- The screen size is large enough to comfortably watch videos while not making the phone so large so it is unwieldy
- Screen resolution, camera quality, sound quality are all great especially at this price.

This phone exceeded my expectations. Plus it looks sleek especially in the gold color. The Huawei Mate SE has the same external design as the Huawei Honor 7x model which was a wide selling phone. This means that many accessories designed to work with the Honor 7x will also work with the Mate SE.

I've had the Huawei Mate SE for about three months and highly recommend it if you're looking for a $200 - $250 cell phone with excellent quality and great selection of features.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I've had this phone for just under 3 months. After only having flagships (iPhone, Samsung & LG), I am very happy with this phone.

The only thing I am unhappy about is no NFC. But for the $224 I paid, I can't really complain. Also, I knew going in the camera was not flagship quality. I don't really use it that often, so I am ok with that. This might be a concern for others.

I find it to be a fast and responsive phone. The battery life is great. The screen is fine. Battery life is excellent. I can leave it unplugged over night at 100% and it's going to be at 98% when I wake up 7 hours later.

I'm with T-Mobile and it works well with their signal. Voice calls have been 100% relaible. It should be noted, I live in a large city

I've had the Huawei mediapad m3 for one year and now the Mate SE. I plan on getting a Huawei flagship for my next phone. I can't say enough about my user experience with Huawei products. I figure I will get a Huawei flagship one iteration behind for $300 and I know I'll be very happy.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Great phone for a great price.
-Beautiful, vivid screen, great for viewing videos and games
-Sleek, attractive design, easy to operate with one hand
-Responsive finger print unlock is super convenient and time saving
-Lots of space left even after built-in apps (about 48gb free out of 64gb)
-Screen flash means low light selfies are better than my previous phones
-Front facing camera takes good quality photos
-Battery lasts ALL day with consistent use on WiFi
-Comes with clear, jelly case which does a fair job of protecting the phone without obscuring its beautiful design (wouldn't count on it to protect against drops, however)

One weakness:
-Built in speakers are not great quality: a bit hollow, tinny sounding and not super loud (although usually use my headphones or bluetooth speakers, so this does not bother me)

Would definitely recommend to a friend.

Ulasan: Replaced my nearly 3 year old LG G4 with this phone. Didn't want to pay flagship prices for a phone I am only going to own for another 3 years. Saw the reviews on this phone and decided "why not?" Have had this phone for 2 months now and not regretting the decision at all! Am new to the brand and it's very easy to learn (it is Android-based). Removed some of the pre-installed software that came with the phone that I wasn't going to use. I've taken some really good pics with this phone, without having to play around with the advanced settings. The phone is fast while navigating different apps as well! I'm heavy on Facebook, Yahoo Finance, YouTube, Mail, and Google. Sound using the phone speakers could be better. The volume seems a bit low. However, when connected to a headset or Bluetooth device, is quite good. The best part of this phone, you ask? The BATTERY LIFE!! I only need to charge this phone every 2 DAYS! Hopefully the battery life stays like that for a while. So I am pretty happy with this phone. Glad I purchased! :-)

Ulasan: Technology is at the point where purchasing a cell phone for $800+ is no longer a necessity if you want a quality device. So many manufacturers are creating devices at budget friendly prices that are quite comparable to the more expensive ones. And, the Huawei device for perfectly into the budget friendly category. Granted, it can't do EVERYTHING the newest device on the market can do, but honestly ask yourself - do you use ALL those features. I, personally, do not, so the Mate SE suits me just fine. It is a great price for such a well made, well functioning phone. I've had it for almost two months now, and I have had no issue whatsoever with it. And, if you care about the version of operating system your phone is running, this phone I'd upgradable to Android 8.0 - Oreo. Seriously recommend this phone if you are budget conscious, and desire good quality.

Ulasan: I bought it for my daughter, and she likes it a lot. This phone is fast, it always gets the strongest wifi signal compared with 4 other phones in my home. For some reason, used the GPS on Google map didn't work at first, after I restarted the phone a couple of times, it works very well now. Thanks Huawei for making such a nice phone at such a reasonable price. I hope the Honor 8x will be here soon.

Ulasan:
The Huawei Mate SE supposedly has an IP67 rating. IP67 means the unit can be dropped into a body of water up to a meter deep for half an hour. I dropped mine into a 4 inch bowl of water for less than 2 seconds and it was damaged beyond repair. Huawei itself refuses to fix the phone since it was dropped in water and it therefore voids the warranty (odd that the warranty doesn't guarantee their IP67 rating, but that's probably common for phones). I tried to get it fixed at a local repair shop but they tried and failed, claiming that they would have to replace the motherboard and the LCD screen. At that point it would be cheaper to buy another phone.

Had it not broken so easily, I would've given the phone 3.5 stars.
Label: Negatif

Ulasan:

My last five personal phones were all Samsung Galaxies. After almost purchasing the new Samsung Note ($1000),I decided to give this highly reviewed and affordable phone a shot first.
I am extremely happy that I did as I am absolutely astounded that a phone of this capability and capacity is available at this price.
I installed my favorite launcher (Smart Launcher) and I was all set.
Great speed, great pics, ultra fast fingerprint sensor, and all around fantastic piece of equipment.
Definitely recommend this affordable powerhouse of a phone.

Literally everything else is good except the sound, but hey saving $600 on an off brand iPhone.

Only downside is no removable battery. Speaking of the battery it is large and easily lasts all day. Overall, a snappy device that is a steal at the price I paid.

In general I love the phone. However I began to notice a problem with notification with two apps. One is ebay the second is my ring doorbell app. For one the ringdoor bell app is missing the app ring tone page to customize notification. Also missed some Ring notification until I manually brought up the app. My ebay notification for some reason have stopped working. I have adjusted battery optimization and notification setting for ebay app and got it to work once and then stopped again. Still working on the these two problems. I have noticed searching the web that other people have complained about the same problem with Huawei phones in general. If I can get this resolve I will have to buy a different phone.

update 12/17/18
I seem to have gotten the notifications working again. You have the adjust the battery optimization settings on a per app basis. I have set ebay to manual control in the battery optimization. I started receiving notification again.

Ulasan:
Great "budget" smartphone! I've had an LG Stylo 3, ZTE Z Max Pro, LG G3, and iPhone 4, and now this Huawei Mate SE is definitely one of the best smartphones I've had. Runs fast and smooth, looks great, battery life is decent (but could be a little better imo), speaker quality and call quality are sufficient. The screen looks awesome and the interface is very responsive on all apps so far! I was in between this and the Honor 7X and from what I've read so far I'm happy with my decision. I'm using MetroPCS as phone carrier. Really enjoy this phone and I'm looking forward to the update to Android 8 Oreo (EMUI 8)!

Great phone with great specs. It is fast and smooth. The camera is great. Low light can be bad but there is an option to lighten up the photo if you tap on the screen before you take the picture. Nice big screen, thin and only 250 bucks. I will never sign a contract where I pay monthly for a phone and then through the nose for a plan as long as I can find homes like this one. Only downside is it is operating Android 7.0. so sending a gif in a text is not possible. Not a deal breaker but annoying. Waiting for the update.

Ulasan: Everything works as intended on this phone, camera stabilization isn't what I was used to, however given the price point and coming from a flagship this was more than acceptable since I don't take many pictures. battery lasts me a good 3 days of normal use, 4 if skip out playing games on my lunch break. Got it used with a minor scratch on the rear. You will need a case of some kind as the phone feels slick with dry hands, which thankfully it came with a clear rubber one. update pushes have been steady and feels like they push more updates than my old phone which I'm grateful for, makes me feel like the product will continue to be supported rather than left and forgotten after a year. The finger print reader is hella fast and 90%+ it gets it the first time even with sloppy pressing.

Amazing interface the phone is lightweight, and everything is just good. Understand that the good comes with the bad and this phone has some bad features such as sometimes poor camera quality.

I really don't know much about phones. I've been an Apple user and this was such a different kind of place, but a good kind of place you know? I'm really surprised with this phone though. I've abused it so much (dropped it, installed some extensive things, sat on it, used it for 20 hours no break) but this phone didn't seem to become worn. Everytime the phone faces adversity, it kept plowing through and just kept working. Even though there were some times that it had froze or shut done unexpectedly, I believe it was my fault for overdoing it a little bit too much.

So yeah! I love this phone and wouldn't want to part with it! It has everything I need and want and that's good!

Ulasan: I got the phone a year ago to use on the road, and while I was happy with it for a while, the honeymoon ended and I was stick with a phone that failed some major requirements. The Huawei implantation of Bluetooth headsets made it impossible to use the Google Assistant - it refused to open the mike, and the built in mike couldn't pick up voice over road noise. The WiFi receiver got worse over time, to the point where I had to reboot if I wanted WiFi to function. That's a problem when you live on the road, connecting to several truck stops and motels a day. Dual SIM was useless, since the second SIM only supports 2G, which is no longer available for some carriers. The camera is subpar, and the speakerphone is unusable even in a quiet room. I finally bought a Moto 6, and relegated this phone to my backup line. That will allow me to benefit from its one outstanding feature, its long life battery.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
The screen is great, good viewing angles, and despite not being in the 'right' aspect ratio for watching 16:9 videos it has above average clarity. Battery lasts for more than a day on a single charge, which is really important for me as I travel long distances and can't afford much downtime.
Camera is alright, quality is definitely in the ballpark of other dual-camera configs. Front camera is meh, good enough for Snapchat but don't expect much.
Finger print sensor is snappy and quick.
WLAN connectivity is eh. You don't get AC wifi on this so you won't be able to utilize the full potential of your wifi if it's faster than 30mbps. Doesn't matter because I don't need that much bandwidth.
The only complaint I have is that EMUI is complete garbage. Installed a third party launcher within 5 minutes of using it. Largest complaint is that it doesn't show the number of notifications I have on the icons, instead it just shows a single red dot and expect me to click on it and check it myself. Comes with minimal amount of bloatware that can be manually removed.
Rubbish speakers, but I don't go anywhere without my bluetooth stereo so they don't matter to me.

For the budget you are actually getting a very good deal. Yeah some compromises here and there but $200 is $200.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I've now had this phone for over a month, so I feel like I can give some feedback and judge the phone objectively. Note that for work I have an iPhone 8, and went to this Mate SE from a Blu Life X2 after it took a tumble.

Phone as a whole:
It's nicely built and looks sleek and modern, as expected from Huawei. The back finger print scanner works extremely well. The size is good for my hands and I can reach all of the screen with my thumb one handed. All apps run smoothly and I haven't had any issues yet. The speaker phone is nice and loud, not too tin can sounding.

Screen:
Bright colors, compared to the iPhone 8, the colors are very comparable. No issues with videos at all.

Battery:
I play Pokemon Go, and I have hosted 2 other devices (kids) with this phone for 4 hours straight and went from 100% to 25%... the kids phones were dying. Brother in law's Samsung Galaxy new version was also in the red. So... pretty nice. For standard usage, this phone lasts all day. Very impressed.

Camera:
Clearly it's not an iPhone, but the pictures are more or less comparable to the iPhone 8. It's not 100% there, but it's crisp enough to print out pictures with Santa.

In all, the wife likes it so I'm buying one for her too. I'd give it 9/10 stars as it's clearly not a flagship phone, but who cares, it's $250.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I am giving my opinion and fact on this product. Many people tend to buy this product mainly for dual sim feature. Unfortunately this mobile will not suit this requirement for the following facts.

When I purchased this product, I went through many reviews in Amazon and based on some satisfaction I went ahead and ordered but got to know after receiving that the second slot which can be used for either second SIM or for memory card supports only 2g. So I am in United States and in this country mobile providers have discontinued 2g long back, very very limited tower gives you 2g signal. My second number which is from India is 4g sim, it did not work as expected in this mobile due to the second slot supporting only 2g. I did not get signal for second slot and I got signal only once for few minutes.

So in my opinion, this mobile is not fit for dual sim facility in ???? United States. This mobile might work good in other country where 2g signal are available.

Since I haven't used the mobile much, I am not giving my feedback on mobile other features like camera, etc.

Hope this helps for customers who are looking this mobile for dual sim facilities.

Ulasan:
It has great spec, incredible value. The only thing I dont like is the micro usb charger port. Huawei Honor 8 introduced in 2016 already has usb c charger port.

Now the best part is the metal case. It is extremely light weight. IMHO, this is the one reason to get this phone. I own Huawei Honor 8 and it has a glass case. Most of the more expensive phones use either glass or crematic for the case. They are heavy and they break easily when you drop your phone accidentally. So you are paying more for expensive phones by having greater risks.

Am I a fan of Huaweis phones? Not yet. I own Huawei Honor 8 and its battery went bad in 11 months, So I will update the review of Mate SE a year from now.

In addition, for USA, Huawei 7X and Huawei Mate SE are similar but Mate SE is better.

US version Mate SE = International version of 7X

US version of 7X. = Trimmed spec of the international version of 7X

Ulasan: I bought one of my kids the Honor 7x and one the Huawei Mate SE. Both are great, low cost and beautiful phones. From the outside, the only difference I can see is the color and the camera housing being a single piece on the Mate SE. You can definitely tell the Mate is a little more responsive with the extra RAM. If you weren't already aware, there are some big limitations to these phones. You can only connect to 2.4Ghz wireless and Bluetooth shares an antenna with wifi, which means you get slower performance on wifi when using blootooth. You also don't get fast charging or USB type C, which really isn't a huge deal to me. It seems to charge fast enough. The body is a great size and it really does look very pretty overall. For kids who want something that looks good, but you won't be too concerned about losing or breaking, this is a great option and one I would recommend. At the current price of $230, the extra 30 dollars is worth it over the 7x for the extra memory/storage.

I really wanted to like this phone and initially I did. Everything about it is great except the reception. I live in a somewhat rural area and in the past I'll have to go outside to make phone calls once in a while. With this phone, even if I go outside, people always complain that I am breaking up or they can't hear me. It will show two bars but have terrible reception. When I'm in other areas I don't seem to have this problem, but it's annoying that my wife can use her phone inside our house just fine and I cannot make a call anywhere on our property when we have the same carrier.

Update:
Phone went swimming in a water bowl for a split second and screen stopped working. Given the opportunity to buy this same phone again (I already had a case and I liked that the micro USB is very popular among other devices) I opted for a different phone in the same price range and just bought a new case and a bunch of new USB c cables. I didn't want to take the risk of having a phone with poor reception issues again, so I went back to Motorola which has never let me down in that area. (Also, my new phone is waterproof, which should prevent another accident like that from happening)

Ulasan:
I purchased Huawei Mate SE with really big expectations after I read a lot of reviews online. But now I am returning it back to Amazon before one month is over.

I am not going to talk about the good stuff about the phone because the phone is really nice. I can say it's really a great phone with really spectacular features. It is really very much customizable, I can say it's much better than any other Android phones out there on the market as to customization perspective. But the phone has lots of downsides and I would like to inform you about these.

The most important problem I have experienced is that the phone's performance declined significantly within a month. The phone slowed down significantly. Sometimes it is responding like 1 to 2 seconds later and this is the most important problem to me. Especially when downloading something or running a few different apps it gets really sluggish. This is very annoying and the phone with these specs and strong processor should not easily be worn out like this. Warning: the processor is made by a Chinese processor company (Kirin), unlike most smartphones this phone does not have Qualcomm brand processor which could be the reason.

I also don't like the display which is not bright enough. The screen brightness is not good at all, it may be okay for the inside environments but when you're out there especially on a sunny day under the sunlight it's it's really not user-friendly even though you max the screen brightness...

Another downside of the phone is the data transfer. The reason I like Android phones because it's easy to transfer data just like plug-and-play or plug your phone into your computer and you can easily transfer data but on this machine you need to download Huawei application to your computer so that you will be able to transfer your data I have experienced that the phone keeps disconnecting during the data transfer. I lost data just because of that and I lost time...

Another reason I bought this phone was to use with my Cricket line and its hot spot but even though the phone is unlocked the hotspot service is not working with Cricket when I checked with Cricket customer service they said that they will get in touch with the manufacturer so the manufacturer will allow hotspot tethering which really sucks. This may depend on the carrier and I would highly suggest being precautious if you intend to use hotspot with this device.

I would like to throw a few words for the battery as well. I am a heavy data user and I can say Huawei Mate SE has a decent battery life. In my case, I was able to get at least 8 hours of battery life with lots of streaming and social media activities.

So like I said, I really like this phone but I'm going to return it back because it has a lot of downsides that really impacts my daily usage...
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Tldr; Great phone for the price. Do not buy for the camera, it has terrible performance!

Let's make this quick.
Pros- The phone is very snappy. Responsive and just a joy to use.
- Screen is great for the price. Feels soft for typing. Decent for videos and zoom is nice for widescreen.
- Allows you to use MOST of the stock Android apps with full support.
- Battery is quite awesome. Processor is fast and efficient.
- Mostly a stock experience after changing a few settings.

Cons- CAMERAS are excessively bad. I can't stress enough that you should buy a different phone if you want a good front and back camera. These are so poor in performance it's kinda sad. Oversaturated, poor auto focus, horrible white balance and exposure settings for auto. Even after trying to install 3rd party apps as well as Google's own camera. I came to the conclusion that the sensor is just grainy and dissapointing. My 3 year old Nexus 6p worth 4 less megapixels takes better photos just cause it uses Google's image processing.
- Huawei's ROM is pretending to be Android iOS it's pretty lame but easily fixed.

End: Glad I bought it totally going to buy one for my dad later in the year.

Ulasan: I was in the market for a mid-range phone, I typically don't invest in expensive flagship phones as being in the construction industry, the more expensive the phone, the faster it seems to break, I had a ZTE grand x4 for roughly the past year and a half, and while it did everything I needed it too, I was just wanting something a little more and a little newer with more storage, I was looking at the xiaomi mi a1, but it didn't appear I would get lte wit at&t, and was also looking at the Motorola g5, but seen a g6 was about to be released and didn't want to wait, so I saw this phone while looking at unlocked phones at Best buy, but they didn't have any in stock so I ordered it from Amazon, and it was 20.00 cheaper. So far it's a great phone, and my only complaint is no USB C and fast charge, something my 70.00 ZTE had. I ordered a magnetic charge cable that should arrive tomorrow and that will hopefully take care of my dislike for micro USB. Lol. But the phone feels quality, the camera is decent, and the screen is beautiful, and has some neat features. I would definitely purchase again.

Ulasan:
I am a US T-Mobile customer and my last 2 phones were:

- Oneplus 1 for 2yrs
- Oneplus 3 for almost another 2yrs.

Both were purchased directly from the Oneplus website, not Amazon. I loved them both. After recently breaking my OP3 I was was devastated to find out that my insurance was not able to provide a replacement phone only a refund, which sounded ok at first (I would just find one here on Amazon). Since I could not afford the price of the new OP6 (just released), I re-purchased a new OP3 from a seller here on Amazon. To my dismay it was an international version and could only receive 2G speeds from my carrier due to the Band range. So after returning it, I found this gem for $150 less than my OP3.

For the last 4 years I have enjoyed the use of phones that were on the pricier side and manufactured by a startup company based out of China. I did my research and Huawei appears to be making phones with great parts for low prices. The total price I paid for this phone was almost $270 total with tax. That is a lot of money to spend when bigger companies like LG and Samsung have nice phones for $200, but their quality is not quite as good Overall (Screen resolution, camera quality, internal storage and RAM that the Mate SE has for $250).

I would recommend this phone for US GSM customers that are comfortable with paying $250 for a $400 phone. With all that said, this phone has a solid build, great specs, and a happy customer.

Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I like this phone a lot. I've had it for less than one week. My previous phone was a google / motorola nexus 6.

Good:
Screen is very nice and bright
Battery life is incredible. will last me two days when my old phone needed charging during each day
Camera is amazing. Front camera is as good as my old phone's back camera
Comes with a nice clear case

Bad:
Touch sensor is not great and sometimes registers a tap as a swipe. I wonder if this is a software or hardware problem
Form factor -- 2:1 aspect ratio is weird and unusual for android. There's a special button to tell the system to stretch the screen for each app. It has worked in every app I've pressed it, but it seems weird. It's also hard for me to reach the whole screen with one hand.
Spyware is factory installed.

I usually like to mod my phone and get root and install custom roms. This phone I haven't even rooted yet, but I still leave that open as a possibility. The built in ROM is quite nice it supports themes including dark mode. I've been using DNS66 to block ads. It works ok, but some sites still show ads. This phone doesn't have a section in XDA yet but the previous model (Honor 7x) does and the development is progressing slowly. This phone is bootloader unlock able and root able using the same procedure as the 7x. Today Huawei released Oreo beta for honor 7x in US and I assume that will come to this phone too.

Overall I'm quite happy with this device and I think that it's pretty good. I hope that Huawei / Hi Silicon release information about the CPU and camera allowing custom kernel and ROM development.
Label: Postif

Ulasan: This Huawei Mate SE is much nicer and more sophisticated than the Honor 5X. The problem I have for both phone is the operating system taking too much space. Ulasan: Phone works fine. I enjoyed using it for gaming and daily usage although, screen is not bright enough. Speaker was loud but at high volume it explodes. However, after 2 weeks of usage the speaker started having problems such as: staticky, and when put on high volume it explodes and after observing it the speaker started weakening and i couldn't barely cant hear anything. I called Huawei support team/warranty department and it was hard communicating with them since they are based in china. They told to me to factory reset my phone every time the speaker stops working. After factory resetting it worked but who would buy a phone that needs to be factory reseted every time something goes wrong with it? . Don't get me wrong the phone is nice and performance is fine. Ulasan:
It's affordable, it's fast, it has a great camera for the price, and the screen is big and easy to read. I've had zero problems with this phone, and only a couple of small caveats that led to not quite making that fifth star. One is a lack of support for 5ghz wifi (a major oversight for a device released in 2018), and the other is that Huawei has discontinued their bootloader unlocking service. They didn't just discontinue it, they lied about when they were ending the service, having announced an end date.. the week after they took down the site. So, if you were hoping to play with custom roms, this is not the phone for you.
Beyond that, it's performed like a champ, and still manages to make it through a day with decent charge, and in my use case, with the murderously battery-draining apps I need to keep loaded on it for my job, that is really saying something. My previous phone, a Blu R1 HD, was at 20% by 6pm, this baby is reporting in with 55% at 10pm.. There's also no dreaded sudden yet silent loss of connectivity requiring a reboot on a daily basis that's so common with chinese phones, either. It's perfectly reasonable to expect 10 days or more of rock solid up time.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Been using it about a week. I will update my review if anything changes.
UPDATE 4/14/18: So something else I don't like is the brightness problem. Regardless of whether you turn on/off the auto brightness, certain apps will dim when used. So my home background and google search or some other apps are all bright but when I open my chrome browser, it gets very dimmed. Only way is to up the brightness to full but that also means everytime I come back to other apps or home background, its so bright. After using EMUI for about a week right now, I find more errors than more convenience. This dimming problem and not getting gmail notification are really starting to get on my nerves. So I had to take one more star away.

I definitely recommend it if you are looking for a good phone under the budget. Everything runs smoothly and camera is actually better than I expected and overall, I can't really complain much because of its great price. However, as someone who has to stay on top of my emails and such for my work, it gets frustrating because getting a notification for my gmails is hit or miss. I also don't get notifications from certain apps but I don't care as much as I care for my emails. I tried looking for battery optimization setting and trying to see if I can excempt it from battery saving etc but no option such as protected apps on this system. Notification is a big, big problem for me and probably lot of people who depend on their phone for work. Other than that, I don't have anything that I dislike about this phone as of yet.

Ulasan:
I have owned this phone a little over a week and can't say anything but good about it. Runs smooth like a champ. All apps are quick and snappy, including games and social media. 64 gb storage and the extra money for 1 extra gig of ram and double the storage was worth it to me. 4 gig ram also allows apps to run quick and even when multiple are running its quite fast. 4g lte is also a great bonus, although it's expected in most smartphones these days.
Battery life is also very good with its close to 3400 mAh battery. I can be on it all day and still have about 30% by the end of the day, given I would run it for 8 to 10 hours straight. The phone is larger than other phones I have owned and some may feel that the screen ratio is strange. I however don't mind it being a bit taller and slender. Some people are worried that because it's not a flagship phone that it won't perform and that is not the case. Fingerprint scanner is very fast and responsive. The camera is mediocre to say the least but what can you expect from a phone that doesn't break the bank at only $229 dollars. Also, for those who are worried about "spying", Huawei is just a company trying to make money like any other. I highly recommend this phone to any who were on the edge about purchasing in the beginning as I was. It is a fantastic product.

Ulasan:
I ordered two, one for my wife and me.
I like the stock like UI and experience of android and hence NOVA launcher is the way to go for me.
But with NOVA launcher going I am facing software bugs, I am not sure if this is because of the nova launcher or a bug within the Huawei version of the android.
When I place a call, for half of the time, I get a message saying 'Call not sent' while the call is already in progress and connected to the network.
The lock screen sometime shows and sometimes doesn't show the global clocks, its a hit n miss
The Huawei weather widget won't show in the list of widgets, it might only be working with the Huawei skin, but still...

I believe the root cause might be a bad integration of NOVA laucher with the Huawei skinned android version or Huawei's reservations with people using launchers in their phones. They do have a warning which warns you about instability of phone with 3rd party launchers.

But then I don't think that's how an android phone should be.
Label: Postif

Ulasan: Beautiful phone and you'll think you have the best hardware/software for the price. THERE IS A REASON FOR THE LOW PRICE. I am pretty sure HUAWEY is aware of this phone's issues and that's why they have other products with similar hardware/software, like the HUAWEY mate 10 pro, at $579. This phone is defective and has very serious signal problems. I understand it uses the same antenna for both Bluetooth and Wi-Fi. You can use only one at a time, you won't know it but you will realize it because of the miserable speed when using Bluetooth. It will not connect to Wi-Fi 5G!!!! Mostly no problems with calls and messages, but video will degrade constantly and images will become completely blurred. This is above ground! I am in NYC and am used to the intermittent signal service in the Subway, as it is only available at the train stations. All my prior phones, including my last Huawei HONOR 5X, worked fine. They would pick up the signal as we approached the station, go full signal at the station and would start losing strength as you move away from the station, but you will be able to connect! This phone is really, really bad at it (horrible really!). You may be at the station already, it would show full signal and 4GTE but it will not connect, it will be frozen, it will not open any pages. Sometimes I go through four or five station before I have a response from the phone. I thought the phone was malfunctioning and got it replaced. Same issue with replacement. I sent the second back to Huawei, I don't know what they did, but phone still the same and never heard from Huawei again. If you only use this above ground for calls and messages, you will like this phone. If you need to use it for the internet or streaming, this is not what you want, and in situations similar to mine, like the subway system, this one really sucks and in case of an emergency underground, you don't want to be caught with this one. DON'T BUY THIS PHONE, IT APPEARS TO BE FACTORY DEFECTIVE.
Label: Negatif

I hate to have to return it unopened, but if providers in my area will not support it then my only other option is to send the poor little phone back. Very sad to have to do this! Oh well... I gotta do what works for me. I am glad so many other people are very happy with their new phone. All my research says it is a great one.

I own a software company and am hard to impress--but this phone impresses me.

I really can't list one flaw with this phone. It makes great calls, both on ATT and when I connect wireless at home. It does Internet toggling beautifully well. It downloads your contacts and calendar from Google.It's very fast. The bluetooth connects easily and, for some reason, the FLAC music I have on the phone sounds much better than it did on my old S6. I use a high-speed 128 GB Samsung SDXC card and it works great (no lag-time like I've read about on other phones).It has an FM radio chip. (Not an app, but an actual FM radio chip.) And the camera is amazing.

How can they sell all of this for $250 ,,, who knows, but it's a bargain you'll love.

Ulasan:
This is my second Huawei phone in a year as I upgraded from an Honor 6x purchased this time last year. That phone was still going strong but I wanted more RAM, storage and solid unibody design. I was so impressed with the 6x after some consideration I decided Huawei ticked all the right boxes once more.

That said this is much the same phone as the 6x but with a different form factor, somewhat stronger processor, and more RAM. Improvements include build quality, more vivid display with higher contrast ratio, smoother HD video streaming, and better audio through the headphone jack. It also has face unlock. However you need to wake the phone to it's lock screen to use the feature. The finger print sensor is faster to unlock the phone, but it's still a neat feature.

Phone has no quick charging capabilities or NFC. It also appears a bit drab in grey as the grey used is...drab. If you want the phone to appear expensive and upscale choose the white and gold varient. Oh, and the camera is good in this segment with lots of features.

For what it is and priced at $200 to $250 it's one of the best choices in smartphones one can make. Sleek, solid, reliable, and modern. I am good to go with Huawei for another year. This a great basic use phone.

Ulasan: So I've owned iPhones and Galaxy's, and after paying a third of the price for this phone I truly believe Huawei is the best of both worlds! The camera is better than the iPhone, it has portrait if you're into that, also the Kirin processer is extremely smooth, almost "Apple smooth". This is the best Android I've owned, and I will never buy a Galaxy again. If you love the iPhone but want to try Android, you will absolutely love this device. Ulasan:
I've had this phone for a few days now. Pros are as everyone else has mentioned. Typing is so fluid and switching between apps and overall processing speed of the phone is incomparable. I replaced a Galaxy Note 5 with this phone, so the improved battery life and increased fluidity is definitely recognizable.

Some issues I have are minor, but I think they're important to know because they are things I will be looking for in a future phone, due to the absence in this one.

1. No quick charging, but I knew this when I bought the phone, just didn't realize how much I valued it due to my high daily usage. To be honest it's not necessary due to this phone's long battery life, but still a nice feature to offer.

2. Lack of tempered glass screen protectors. You will get frustrated trying to find one because for some reason this model isn't popular enough. A lot of cases though.

3. Notifications not expandable on lockscreen. Some may feel this is hit or miss, but I really miss being able to quickly reply or check a full notification on my home screen. I messaged Huawei, they said this won't be capable on this phone at all.

4. No wifi calling, again I already knew this when I bought the phone but would be nice to have.

5. No NFC reading capability. Doesn't affect me but important to know.

I wouldn't buy this again at 250 because of these little nuances, but it truly is a good mid range phone and does last all day which is very valuable. I'd recommend just waiting till it goes on sale to get it, unless you need a phone right away.

Ulasan:
I bought this phone to not only review on my channel since I'm a tech reviewer, but also because I needed a backup phone as my main Axon 7 phone is starting to display some iffy battery life. With that being said, this phone is quite the buy and for $250 dollars you are getting one of, if not the best budget smartphone of the year for now.

The Full HD plus screen is quite eye catching and visually pleasing and you can see this even more so with some nice wallpapers in the background. The colors look more cooler and arguably more naturally looking compared to the slight oversaturation of Quad HD AMOLED displays. I love the sleek and light form factor of the phone but the design doesn't give me much of a WOW factor as compared to some other Huawei phones I've seen. While I am slightly perplexed as to why this phone comes with a micro usb port, I appreciate that they still have the 3.5mm headphone jack.

The dual camera at the back shoots some nice pictures with good dynamic range, sharpness and clarity in good lighting conditions. Video recording at 1080p 30 frames is good but with no optical image stabilization, you will need a stabilizer or small tripod to get some stable footage. There are a respectable number of filters and camera modes such as slow motion, panorama, and one of my favorites, Light Painting. The front camera, which is 8 MP, unfortunately takes some slightly out of focus face shots and its beauty mode is more of a hit or miss and looks as though it is making my face more artificial. Even when you turn it off fully, I feel that the camera is still adding the beauty effect in some shape or form. AR Lens has some face animations but they are few and won't be replacing your Snapchat animations anytime soon.

The software is EMUI 5.1 with Android 7.0. I actually have no issues with the user interface and navigating it was fluid and seamless. I like the battery management systems and the pre-installed virus scanner which is powered by Avast. The fingerprint scanner is pretty fast and possibly one of the fastest on any phone in this price range. The performance is definitely good as playing games was pretty good. I did notice that more heavily graphic intensive games, such as Asphalt 8, may lag and drop frame rates a bit but that it not always the case. Switching between apps and using multi window is done fluently on this phone.

Two main red flags were found in my experience with the phone. There seems to be an overheating issue as the phone really heats up after a while of watching Youtube videos and playing games. The temperature rises to the point that I have to hold the phone a certain way so that my palms won't be affected as much. Secondly, the single speaker grill can easily be blocked when using the phone in landscape mode and the speaker lacks good bass and loudness, even on its highest volume.

Other than those two main gripes and the slight issue with the front camera, the phone is perhaps the best budget smartphone you can buy and is great for all daily tasks and even some light to moderate gaming. I am already considering to make this phone my daily driver but only time will tell.

I'd like it to have Qi charging and water resistance, but at this price it's excusable. It has micro USB (stop crying people), so what. Just pointing it out. Lack of GHz WiFi. Haven't noticed it being an issue. Lack of a few obscure random AT&T or T-Mobile bands... again haven't noticed any real world issues. The stock launcher is a bit "different" if you're coming from Samsung or some other Android skin. Give it a week and it's no big deal. If you're coming from an iPhone it'll be quicker.

Ulasan:
The Mate SE is built very, very, well - it definitely feels like a premium phone and is an incredible value. Sticking with industrial design, the weakest points of the Mate SE are the front-facing logo (seriously, why? put a logo on the rear if you must), and the screen. The screen has a slight bit of grain to it. The grain is most visible on white content, e.g. in Google Now or if you open a new tab in Chrome. Might not be an issue for some.

The WORST thing about the SE is the software. It only ships with android 7.0, and EMUI is *awful*. I installed Nova, and even tried out a few EMUI themes to try and get the quick settings & settings menu to be more like stock Android. Then I found that Huawei had also replaced Android's standard 'share' menu (e.g. when one shares a photo from Google Photos to WhatsApp) with their own inferior version.

Huawei: please join the 'android one' program, and ship stock Android on your phones. This will also make it easier for you to provide OS updates for your phones.

If the Mate SE had stock Android, it would be fantastic. I can't accept EMUI though, and have returned the phone as a consequence. I highly recommend that anyone considering this phone purchase the Xiaomi Mi A1 instead - that's what I did. The Mi A1's build quality is excellent, it has no front-facing logo, and it is part of the android one initiative, running stock Android 8.0 - it is incredible. (It does have larger top & bottom bezels than the Mate SE, but in all other aspects the Xiaomi Mi A1 is better, or at least as good.)

Do NOT buy the Mate SE - get the Xiaomi Mi A1!
https://www.amazon.com/Xiaomi-Android-Cameras-Unlocked-Warranty/dp/B076HQ6FSY/

I ordered this phone for my mother. Everything was great with the setup except when we tried to connect to WiFi, we kept getting an error "WiFi - Denied Access to Network". We tried everything to include resetting the phone back to factory settings. Still no luck! Other phones connected to the house WiFi with no problems. I ordered a replacement phone. I'll update my review.....only if it works like its supposed to.

Update: I finally discovered a fix by accident. First...take the phone to a carrier store to have them set it up and connect it to their network. My mother is on T-mobile. Second...go to a public place like Starbucks and use their wi-fi to complete all the phone updates. Headsup...you will be there for a while so make sure you have plenty of power. Once finished you should be on latest Android version 7.1. You can now go home and connect to your personal network. The phone no longer has any issues nor receive that stupid error anymore. Good-Luck!

Ulasan:
I've been using the Mate SE for the past few days and thought I'd leave a review to help others decide when considering this phone. I've been a Google Nexus (5, 5X, 6P) user for the past several years, so leaving Google devices was a leap of faith for me, but my 6P was experiencing the cold battery shutoff at 40+% issue so it was time to try something new.

I want to add a disclaimer that I am including the price point as a major part of my decision to give the phone 4 (really 4.5) stars. I mean, THIS PHONE IS $229!!!

A second disclaimer is that I am by no means a power user. My typical uses for my phone are texting, web browsing, watching youtube videos, navigation, some social media, and taking photos. I do not game on my phones, so my review is not evaluating gaming performance.

The Pros:
-Smooth operation. For my everyday use, the speed of opening apps and switching between apps is great and I have no major complaints. There are occasional times when scrolling isn't quite as smooth as on my 6P or my girlfriends S8+, but this is also being nit picky. Again, 95% of the time its great.
-Great screen. The screen is big, the bezels are small, the picture is clear and sharp and the colors are accurate to my eyes. The auto brightness feature also works quickly and seems to adjust to a comfortable level based on the surrounding lighting.
-Premium feel. I've been using the phone without a case since I got it and I like how the aluminum body feels in my hand, although it is a little slippery. The buttons feel nice and solid
-Fast fingerprint scanner. The finger print scanner is at least as fast as the 6P if not faster, and is quite accurate. I've only had it miss my finger print a handful of times and it was likely my fault for bad placement
-Slim design. Because of the small bezels and the thinness of the phone, the mate SE is easier to carry in my pocket than the 6P.
-Headphone jack! It has a damn headphone jack for those of us that haven't cut the cord on our headphones yet.
-Availability of themes. Having used stock android for the last few years, I didn't particularly like the stock EMUI theme that ships with the phone, but there are theme packs available for download on the play store that allow you to change the theme to pixel, oreo, etc.
-Battery performance. Again I'm not a power user, but I have been consistently making it through the day with 60% battery remaining when I plug my phone in before going to sleep.
-VALUE!!! During my research for a new phone, this phone offered the best features for the price. Hands down.
-Camera IN GOOD LIGHT. In daylight or bright light the camera is actually pretty good if you have a steady hand. The pro mode on the camera allows for pretty decent picture taking if you are willing to adjust some settings. I also like the bokeh/low aperature mode for taking macro shots. Its not as good as the pixel camera, s8/s9 or iphone but its pretty decent IN GOOD LIGHTING.

The Mehs:
-Bloatware. There isn't a ton of bloatware, but it is a bit annoying that you can't uninstall most of the apps that ship with the phone. I prefer to use the google apps, and I can't delete the stock email app, calendar app, etc. Not a huge deal, but meh.
-Nougat. the Mate SE ships with nougat, although a google search will show that Huawei is beta testing Oreo for the 7X and an updated EMUI. Hopefully the stable version is released this spring or summer.
-Typing mistakes. I seem to make more mistakes typing on this phone than my 6P for some reason. Perhaps it is the screen protector I have on it which isn't the best. just something to note, not a huge deal.

The Bads:
-Camera in low light. I'm just going to be honest here, the camera is terrible in low light compared to my 6P. Google is king of image processing and the Mate SE is no where close to any google device in low light camera performance. Keep in mind though, that this phone is also 1/3rd the price of the Pixel 2 and almost a 1/4 the price of the Pixel 2 XL, so a worse camera in some situations is expected at this price point.

Overall, if you are in the market for a new phone, and don't want to spend close to $1000 for a new flagship, the Mate SE is definitely a phone to consider if you don't mind the poor low light camera performance. Everything else with the phone feels on par with other big name phones, for a fraction of the price!
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I recently came from the Samsung Galaxy S8, as my relative needed a phone, and I wanted to be free of my financing plan.

That being said, I was skeptical but pleasantly surprised. The Mate SE is a great phone. Here are a summary of points I liked about the phone:

Pros:
-Great Camera. Lots of options like AR mode, Pro Mode, Document Scanner, Food mode etc. High quality 18 MP dual lens system.
-EMUI is updated to Andriod 8.0 Oreo for a smooth running system with features like live screen recording, split screen, and more.
-Dual Sim unlocked, and SD card ready. SD card can be formatted or separate storage, which is nice.
-Performance with 4 GB of ram and 64 GB of storage is blazing fast, especially with the Kirin chipset.
-Screen resolution is nice, especially for the price, colors pop and are bright, but its not as extremely crisp as a Galaxy screen.
- Quick Charge enabled. Can charge 0 to 100 in around an hour and a half. Battery is also large and if used from 100% at 7 am can go up to 45% at 11:30 pm meaning more than enough for a day of use. (Medium use at half brightness).
- Comes with a case, always a perk. Case isn't top tier BUT its rigid enough for the job.
- Screen is bigger than my old Galaxy S8, relative's Iphone 8 plus and Iphone x. Full Screen mode works flawlessly and is better than flagship full screens.
- Speaker is loud and booming with no distortion at max volume.
- One handed mode comes in handy and makes usage easier.
- Fingerprint sensor is quick, easy, and conveniently placed, way better than the Galaxy S8!

Now on to the Cons:

- While the camera is amazing, low light selfies and pics will be a bit fluffy, although the flash can fix that.
- The phone uses micro USB, which is fine, its an advanced version of the port, but I would've liked to see USB type C.
- Screen resolution is high, but some apps looked better on the Galaxy S8. But for the price its not a deal breaker at all. Screen is more than enough.

All in all, I HIGHLY recommend this phone for anyone who wants a flagship experience for $249.99, and wants to be free of contracts and financing. Im extremely happy with this purchase and don't regret switching from the Galaxy S8.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I love this phone!! I swear, this is totally the best phone I've ever had!

I just bought this phone a few days ago to replace my Huawei Honor 5X. It arrived yesterday and I'm very pleased with it!

The speed is amazing and light-years faster than the older model (Honor 5X) and the fingerprint scanner is excellent. A quick touch to the back of the phone and it's immediately unlocked. I love that!

The camera works great and is very responsive. There is hardly any delay when taking pictures.

The Honor 5X I had before this one lasted a long time. I had it well over a year at least and I had dropped it numerous times on hard floors and concrete without it ever breaking the screen. I expect this one will be just as durable.

If you're looking for a phone with great features, durability, and a high quality feel, this is by far the the best phone for the price.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Yes, there is something missing or not as good, but, for this price tag and what it offers, it is an excellent phone. Highly recommended. It has everything you really need.
No NFC (Near Field Communications): You cannot "Google Pay" wirelessly, period; No 5Ghz WiFi (You have to stay at crowded 2.4Ghz. It is fine. You really don't feel you miss anything); No replaceable battery; No wireless/fast charging; No water-proof; No high speed USB 3.0; No stereo speakers; No gyroscope (do you really need it?); No native WiFi Calling (if you are a T-Mobile customer, you can use "T-Mobile DIGITS" doing WiFi Calling); Camera is not as good at Low Light condition, and without Image Stabilizer (but it is not bad at all and the built-in Camera app has a lot functions.16+2M dual main at f2.2 and 8M front at f2.0); Use old micro-USB port without Type-C (which I like the "old" micro-USB that I can use all my chargers and power banks.); And, it has FM radio (yes, good) using 3.5 mm audio (I like the 3.5 mm) headset (not provided) as its antenna; Great 5.93 inch 18:9 display at 1080p x 2160p, 407 ppi (though it is not OLED, great display); Beautiful metal case with clear-color soft TPU protection case; 4GB RAM with 64GB storage (still not enough storage? you can insert in a micro-SD card up to 256GB); Dual-nano-SIM (2nd SIM only for 2G); Excellent finger print sensor with gesture controls; EMUI interface is actually pretty good. You can select between drawer or standard mode; not many "other" apps (if you don't use it, you can delete or disable it.)... and it is built by HUAWEI, a big brand in China and Europe.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
PRO:
Very fast, much faster than Moto G5, no problem to play games. My first phone with Kirin CPU, not sure it is the CPU or large RAM made this phone faster than Moto G5.
The fingerprint scan is accurate and fast.
The camera is good, both front and rear, a little overexposed some time.
Charging is fast, it takes about 90 minutes to get fully charged.
EMUI has a lot of features, very easy to access flashlight, calculator...
Install google launcher, "Google now/feed" works. (It does not work on Moto G5).
The price is great, for $229, cannot get any phone better than this.

CONS:
WIFI is only 2.4GHz, it will be a trouble with a lot of neighbors.
MicroUSB 2.0 but not Type-C? Huawei had too many spare parts?
Many pre-installed apps? I'm assuming Huawei get paid to install those apps.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I wish I had heard of this company before buying all these second hand Samung/Motorola phones through craigslist just to save money, when I can buy a comparable phone brand new for a price that is cheaper. This phone is just an improved version of the Honor 7X.

My review is based off replacing a Samsung Note 4 and my work phone is a Galaxy S7.

Battery:
The battery life is superb on this. Seeing how my Note 4 had all this bloatware and these Samsung extras out of the box. The Note 4 couldn't even last through out the day with constant usage. This phone lasts through out the day, set it down without charging it for the night and it still has power.
Battery life is about the same as the S7, though.

Design:
Doesn't feel like a cheap, cricket phone. Feels like it has some weight, some heft to it. I am also impressed by the fingerprint technology on the back of the handset. It is much better and responsive then what the Galaxy S7 has. I never had to 'retry' my fingerprint as if it didn't register it.

Communications:
Haven't noticed any difference in terms of call quality or signal. Yet, my carrier is AT&T. The only concern is that the phone doesn't support 5G Wi-Fi.

Camera.
Unless something was wrong with my Samsung Note 4, this camera is much better than the Note, but similar to what the S7 has, or maybe even less.

Display:
I can't tell if this is part of the android or part of Huawei, but there are animations in the display which are interesting. From where you can see the display brightness slider move automatically to where texts seem to 'bounce' when you scroll through them. There is little bloatware and I like the drawer design of the apps. Screen is also bigger than my Note 4.

Also some people state the charging cable is different, yet my cord that charges my samsung phones can charge this phone.

At the end of the day, this phone can do everything a $1,200 phone can do.

Update Six Months Later:
Phone still going strong. My only major issue is that GPS is horrible with this phone. From Waze to Google Maps, the signal isn't consistent and drops when it comes to GPS. Never experienced anything like this, and it's been like this day one.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:

This is the worst support call I've ever had. To cut a long story short, the support rep told me that all my apps not compatible with Huawei so I need to contact all the developers and ask them why their apps are not compatible with huawei and that's why they're closing. Are you kidding me?!!!!! ... Contact every single developer for every App on my phone. Even the Huawei Phone Manager App closes. My goodness they're stupid.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PHONE.

The phone is OK .. the response time when you click an app is really slow and noticeable. I guess that's what you get on a budget phone with a Kirin processor instead of a snapdragon.
----------------------------------------------------------------UPDATE July 2018---------------------------------------------------------
After using this for a few months, it's worse than I thought. A big negative for this phone is that it automatically closes apps even those that you don't want closed. Even after setting the apps not to optimize, that feature is just there but doesn't do anything because Huawei disabled it. Very annoying. Also seeing that they've decided not to stop giving out the bootloader unlock code, this phone is more useless to me than a tree branch. This is my first and definitely my last Huawei phone.

Ulasan:
UPDATE: Released Android 8.0 today, 5/16/2018. Update is nice and seems quicker navigating apps.

I've had the phone for a little over the week, and it's just plain awesome. I am a techy, however, I didn't want to spend $700-1000 on the new flagship phones. This has exceeded my expectations by far: the processing is extremely fast, the fingerprint is flawless, the EMUI is neat, and the camera is awesome as well. My wife has an iPhone 7 ($750) from At&t and this Mate SE beats it spec wise except for a few things. In my comparing, the iPhone 7 has 4k video recording, and 1080p recording with the front facing camera. However, the front facing camera of this Mate SE has 720p recording which is still high quality. The Mate SE does not film in 4k, however, in my opinion, it makes up for this with the variable apperture. The screen for the Mate SE is very large and has a good brightness with auto-brightness adjustment sensitivity. It is very clear and responsive to your touch. Day to day tasks are a breeze, email, internet, YouTube, etc. You will enjoy your new phone, even if your coming from the top brands.

P.s. this phone has a document explorer with a great UI. I know this will come in handy for downloading files and reopening them.

Overall I rate 5 ??. You just can't beat the quality for price.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Not much to add as far as what others have already said about this phone. I too was coming off a 3 year old Galaxy S6 Edge which is now in its time to fail period. This phone blows it away in almost every aspect and the S6 was the premium flagship that outclassed the previous versions by quite a lot. Now budget phones are beating the former best phones on the market not that long ago, truly amazing. This modified Android I actually like better then stock, it's simple and intuitive. Internet, fingerprint reader, everything is just fast! Love that it still has a straight headphone jack! Don't you dare change that please!
Camera is more then good enough but I'm not a picture fanatic so it might not work for those looking for real high end photos from a phone. The AMOLED screen of the old Galaxies are still better then this but not enough to not still make this phone overall better hardware/price wise. The only con I see is not directly related to the phone, and that is case availability. I used to love that Otterbox Defender with a built in screen protector available for previous Galaxy versions. Sadly Otterbox has mostly given up on that and making cases for any other manufacturers besides Apple and Samsung. I ordered a soft pouch for extra protection. I do like that this is a plus size phone, I will never go back to smaller. Buy this phone, you will not be disappointed.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
I got this phone yesterday on 6/2/18 and am mostly very pleased. I will update if things change but here's my initial opinion on this phone.

Screen/display: 10/10 - crisp, bright, beautiful display. It reminds me of using an iPhone OS.

Speed: 10/10- no lags, fingerprint sensor opens lightning fast. No hiccups so far. I like that I can add multipe fingerprints and can use the fingerprint to open certain secure apps on my phone.

GPS: 6/10 - I've only used it once, but I think it was a little uncertain as to where I was. Good thing I actually knew where I was going. But GPS is something I highly depend on so I'm a little disappointed. Will use more and update as needed.

------ 6/5/18 UPDATE: GPS 10/10 - I've since changed some settings on my GPS to make it more accurate. It is very fast with finding my location,and re-routing if necessary, and GPS signal seems to be accurate.

Camera: 7/10 -coming from a Blu studio one which took pretty decent pics (I think was 12 mp) and a Samsung Galaxy amp prime which took very average pictures (with an even lower mp rating), I'm not overly impressed or disappointed. The camera is ok, but nothing too incredible in my opinion.

Sound: 5/10 - I feel this is very quiet. I had alarms wake me which I barely heard. I turned the volume up so we will see if that solves. Sound clarity on calls appears decent. As someone who connects phone to car via Bluetooth daily, I was pretty disappointed in lack of bass while playing songs. I will test it out more and update accordingly.

Battery: 8/10 - I got the phone about 60% charged and when I went to charge to 100, it took at least 2-3 hours. I was surprised at how slowly it seemed to charge. I slept with it on the charger last night since I like to start the day at 100% so today will be the first day on full battery to test the battery life.

------ 6/5/18 UPDATE: Battery 9.5/10. I just used my phone from 100% to 2% (it wouldn't discharge below that, and gave a 30 second warning stating the phone was shutting off because the battery is empty). It lasted 2 full days ( I was hoping I could get 2.5 or 3 days) without additional charging and that it with a lot of screen-on time surfing the web, downloading apps, social media, etc (nothing too heavy like gaming). While I was at work today I did not check my phone however the charge seemed to stay pretty much put as I hoped it would do (even with syncs, wifi, GPS/location, and Bluetooth all turned on). I have had phones that would discharge as much as 10-20% just sitting in my purse/locker untouched. Also, I put it on the charger tonight when it died and it charged up from 2% to 75% in less than 1 hour. I'm not sure why the initial partial charge took so long, but this seems promising!

Again, I've had the phone for less than 24 hours, so this is just my initial review and will change as I use and experience it more.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
Overall I'm pleased with the phone. It has just about every feature I'd want at a price point that is sane. Updated to Oreo right away. Not perfectly responsive but way better than I'm used to. I've read about a lot of problems with Huawei and Fitbit devices, but my Charge 2 seems to be working fine after some patience with it's first sync. EMUI is fine; just a different flavor of essentially the same stuff as stock Android. A nice surprise was FM radio is supported with wired headphones plugged in and a preloaded app. Also it comes with a decent clear case.

Can't necessarily complain about it having USB micro, non-AMOLED screen, GSM only, single speaker. If you want the whole enchilada go buy a phone that is four times the price.

My few unpleasant surprises:
* The biggest one: no support for wake with "Ok Google". You'll have to press a button on screen every time you want to give voice commands. I actually miss this from my Nexus 5X that died and kind of expect it on any Android phone now. Kind of a big deal. Otherwise this might have been five stars.
* The automatic screen brightness tends to adjust too dark fairly often and I need to turn it back up.
* Bluetooth seems to stutter audio streams randomly (half second of silence then continued audio occasionally) but not often or consistent enough to warrant returning the phone.
* Camera is not great for low light or even moderate motion is bright daylight. Your dog will need to be still if you want crisp pictures.
* Huawei has their own OS-integrated versions of basic apps such as contacts, dialer, SMS, music that you can't uninstall. Whatever though. Maybe someday we'll get stock Android.
Label: Postif

Ulasan:
There is no other way to put it, this is an excellent device at excellent value. The only complaint I have is the confusion with how many devices there are from Huawei for different markets. I purchased 2 phones BEFORE this one. First a Nexus 6P (more for Google, but because Huawei built this phone I was more comfortable trying a pure Huawei phone afterwards) then an Honor 7X. This is where I had some trouble, because I purchased the international version, which was not made clear as to what networks it supports in the U.S, and many different websites have conflicting information based on whether you pull up the 3GB RAM model VS the 4GB RAM model. It's difficult to have confidence in your purchase when buying elsewhere, but buying the Mate SE from Amazon definitely gave me security and confidence in the choice I was making.

As for the device. WOW... I knew I wanted to get it for the extra gig of ram and the Octa-core processor, but this phone continues to impress. I haven't had a single hick-up or issue with anything so far, if it weren't for the network issue I would have never gotten rid of the 4GB RAM 7X, the Mate SE makes you very happy that Huawei is working with American distributors because this is a very underrated device. Shipped and arrived next-day, effortless sync, Android experience is smooth, and I do like the skins though I haven't changed any themes myself. Camera is ultra-responsive, finger-print is incredibly accurate and unlocks quicker than half-a second, which is hard to comprehend for the price and something I noticed was also equally responsive on the 7X. Just overall incredibly impressed. Oh and there's a free case which ships with the phone as well, which is just an unexpected plus that makes you happy you chose to support this company.

In all honesty, I feel like if OnePlus weren't trying to compete on upper-tier financial markets they would be cranking out phones like this no problem, but they're missing a chance to compete with yet another market that is making unparalleled devices for an unbelievable cost. For the first time my phone has as much RAM as my laptop and I didn't pay too much...
Label: Postif

Ulasan: Oh my goodness I love this phone. Why would you play 700 800-900 $1,000 for a phone when you can get this one. It's fast it's easy. I love it much more than my Samsung S6. I have Cricket as my carrier and all I did was take the SIM card out of my S6 and put it into this phone. I'm very very pleased with this phone
